ETYMOLOGY: From Old French tenant, present participle of tenir ('to hold'), from Latin tenere ('to hold')

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: noun: a word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things (common noun), or to name a particular one of these (proper noun).
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A person who occupies land or property rented from a landlord.
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The tenant complained to the landlord about the leaky faucet.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 房客向房东投诉水龙头漏水的问题。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: noun: a word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things (common noun), or to name a particular one of these (proper noun).
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A person who holds (a place, position, or principle); an occupant or inhabitant, especially in a historical or legal context.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 占有人；持有者（尤指持有某项权利或官职的人，较旧或正式用法）
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: He was a tenant of the royal lands, owing fealty to the king.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 他是王室土地的占有人，效忠于国王。
